text: Pirig-me (Sumerian: , Pirig-me), was a Sumerian ruler (ensi) of the state of Lagash in Southern Mesopotamia who ruled c. 2200 BCE. He was the son of Ur- Ningirsu I. Pirig-me is only known from one inscription and from one year name: The inscription on a brick reads: His was succeeded by Lu-baba. ==References== Category:Sumerian rulers Category:22nd-century BC rulers
title: Pirig-me
